Package nl.tno.stormcv.model

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CVParticle
    An abstract Computer Vision Particle superclass which contains the information required for all objects processed by the platform: streamId: an identifier of the stream a piece of information refers to sequenceNr: the number within a stream a piece of information refers to (typically the frame number of a video stream/file) metadata: Map<String,Object> that can be used to for other information Most of the standard components within StormCV make use of the streamId and sequenceNr to group, filter and order objects they get.
    Descriptor
    This CVParticle implementation represents a sparse descriptor which is part of a Feature and has the following fields: boundinbBox: an optionally zero dimensional rectangle indicating the region in the image this Descriptor describes duration: the duration of the descriptor which may apply to temporal features like STIP values: the float array used to store the actual descriptor (for example 128 values describing a SIFT point)
    Feature
    This CVParticle implementation represents a single feature calculated for Frame and has the following fields: name: the name of the feature like 'SIFT', 'SURF', 'HOG' etc duration: the duration of the feature in case it describes a temporal aspect of multiple frames sparseDescriptors: a list with Descriptor objects used to described sparse features like SIFT denseDescriptors: a three dimensional float array much like the OpenCV Mat object which can be used to represent dense features like dense Optical Flow It is not always clear how a specific descriptor should be stored and it is typically up to the characteristics of the topology and context what is the best way to go.
    Frame
    A CVParticle object representing a frame from a video stream (or part of a frame called a Tile).
    GroupOfFrames
    This CVParticle implementation represents a group (1 or more) of Frame objects and can be used to send multiple frames at once to a Bolt.
    VideoChunk
    Represents a piece of video containing a number of encoded frames.
